SINT_Prompt_Task.Objective: Evaluate the sustainability of various urban development models, considering environmental, social, and economic factors. Use the Debates (N=4) + Conflict (Step 3A) methodology with numerical ratings, cross-evaluation, and iterative synthesis.
SINT_Prompt_Task.Context: Urban development models include suburban sprawl, compact city, transit-oriented development, and smart city approaches. Key sustainability factors include resource consumption, carbon emissions, social equity, economic viability, and quality of life.

Consultant.Name: Urban Planner
Consultant.Focus: Land use efficiency, transportation systems, infrastructure design

Consultant.Name: Environmental Scientist
Consultant.Focus: Resource consumption, carbon footprint, ecosystem impact

Consultant.Name: Sociologist
Consultant.Focus: Community formation, social equity, quality of life, cultural preservation

Consultant.Name: Economist
Consultant.Focus: Development costs, economic returns, affordability, market dynamics

SINT_Prompt_Task.Methodology: Expert Debates (N=4) + Conflict (Step 3A) with numerical ratings, cross-evaluation, and iterative synthesis
SINT_Prompt_Task.Finalization_Protocol: All expert positions must include detailed arguments with concrete examples, data points, and numerical ratings. The process must include iterative rounds of criticism and synthesis with detailed cross-evaluation between all experts. Output must include multiple rounds of criticism, iterative convergence, and comprehensive synthesis.
